title: How are self esteem and self confidence connected? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s start off by defining both: I believe that self-esteem is highly over-rated. Just think about the word, “esteem”. It basically means to hold in high respect. For example, you might say “I hold (name a great person you admire) in high esteem”. “I really esteem (name). Now say the same thing about yourself. “I hold myself in high esteem”. “I really esteem myself”. When you say it this way it doesn’t sound quite right does it? Sounds arrogant or conceited. I suppose we all should have a certain level of respect for ourselves, but an elevated esteem for oneself is also known by another name…narcissism. Confidence on the other hand has two basic definitions. 1 - a FEELING of certainty or assurance (most common and thought of definition) 2 - an ACT trust or reliance So how do these definitions correlate? Must you have a high respect for yourself to feel confident? It probably doesn’t hurt but an overly inflated self-esteem will make confidence come off as cocky and arrogant. Must one have high respect for oneself to take the actions of confidence? I don’t think so. It is my assertion that self-acceptance is much more important than self-esteem. A healthy self acceptance feeds confidence in a much more healthy and productive way.

Wow!!! What an amazing question! Ironically the answer is in their connected word self. What is self-esteem? “a confidence and satisfaction in oneself” Definition of SELF-ESTEEM What about self-confidence? “confidence in oneself and in one's powers and abilities” Definition of SELF-CONFIDENCE That seems very similar and I don’t feel it does justice to the subtleties. I tend to think of one as “contentment” and the other one as “capability”. In self-esteem I am happy about who I am, I am my own friend, I can even believe myself to be incompetent and be okay with it. In self-confidence I can hate myself. I can despise the person I am and the place within my mind that I exist, however I have total confidence in my ability to execute my evil schemes.

Self-confidence makes no sense. What does that mean? If I put a person with self-confidence, with no previous experience, in charge of the executive branch of a country, is that a good thing? I don’t think so. Better to put a person in charge who knows how to take information in, test it, and then recognize when confidence is high or when confidence is low. This is not SELF-confidence, because it did not come from within. Rather it came from experience in testing outside information. If a person can show the ability to recognize when they should feel high confidence or low confidence, and then act accordingly, then that person can be trusted to lead, regardless of how much self-esteem they hold for themselves. A person with high self-esteem believes they are worthy of respect. They may not be highly skilled in any particular area, but that’s okay. They hold themselves in high esteem, regardless of how they compare to others.

Self esteem is how you feel about yourself. Self confidence is how you appear to feel about yourself. Those with positive self esteem seem naturally confident. In an analogy, they’re not sweet like a sugary Pepsi. They’re sweet like a fresh squeezed orange juice. Those with low self esteem tend to have an air of false confidence. Continuing our analogy, they are “sweet” on the surface but unhealthy inside. If you try to be more confident without addressing how you feel about yourself, first, you’re only addressing the surface of the issue—not the root. Whereas if you address the root first, appreciate yourself first, work on yourself first, self confidence becomes a natural portrayal of who you are deep down.

So is your mindset that build your self esteem or be the cause to lack of self esteem and it goes for building your self confidence. These are all come back to this fact,what kind of mindset do you have? do you have a comparative mindset ? Are you in constant comparing and competing with others which it brings nothing but depression, lack of confidence and insecurity in life OR You have a creative mindset and understand you born unique and your uniqueness is your power (this is your true self esteem comes from) You realized everything you do need to achieve your goal and fulfill your purpose is already in you ( this is your self confidence) and all you need to do is to grow mentally and spiritually and work on personal development to bring out and develop your gift and your ability.

I am convinced that confidence is definitely related to one’s self esteem. I don’t believe a person can have one without the other! Of course, I am speaking my own truth. Just for an example, I have been unable to work a job for over 18 months now due to back problems. Just standing at the kitchen sink for 5 minutes sends me into pain that renders me useless. I have never felt incapable , or been incapacitated in any way before. So needless to say my self esteem has dropped to an all time low. I cannot even support or take care of myself. Hence there goes my confidence! I am hesitant to even take a job because I worry that I fail…I am NOT that girl! I am unable to (fully) accept that I am disabled, and I tell myself I can do it, I will not wither and die! But my question? How do I regain my self esteem, and confidence now? It is a scary thought, and I can’t seem to stop obsessing on what do I do now???

Hello Erfan Self Esteem = How much a person likes themself Self Confidence = How much a person believes in themself (belief in their ability to perform tasks or any endeavour) A person’s Self Confidence ie their ability to perform a task is dependent on their Self Esteem. Self Esteem is how much they value themself in their ability to do the task. Example: A person values / likes / appreciates their ability to take penalties in Football (Self Esteem). They then believe they can score with confidence at anytime in a match, even in the last minute to score the match winner. The priority is not so much to analyse the difference or how they co-relate… the key is to advance understanding of the two, then attain mastery of both… then  Thanks for asking Bhavin

Self-esteem relates to your value and love for yourself. Self-confidence is more about your belief in your own abilities. When you love and value yourself, you are likely to become more confident and take more risks. In return, as your achievements and accomplishments increase, your over-all sense of esteem does also. They definitely work hand-in-hand with one another.

The correlation between self esteem and self confidence is simply “self”. Esteem is defined by the respect and value you place on yourself. Confidence is defined by the trust, belief, and assurance of something, in this case ones self. To better understand I'll include an example. When you want to complete a task you haven't before, self esteem plays its part by you knowing you are worth the results the task will bring you, self confidence plays its part by giving you the belief, faith, and reassurance in yourself to actually move towards and compelte the task even through the obstacles that you may face.

In the optimal circumstance the two are the same, with esteem recognizing your talents and the skills you have for working with people, and confidence helping you determine how to use those talents in ways that promote interactions, not endanger them. As you probably know, the danger is offending others by showing too much pride to their discomfort. Perhaps keeping this slight difference in mind would help you determine the best action in any situation to avoid the possible negative consequences when the person you are interacting with miss interprets you.

As you love yourself- self esteem increases,makes you more confident, as confidence increases, over all self-esteem increases. Great cycle, huh ? You are braver then you believe, Stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. So said Christopher Robin to Winnie-the Pooh.

It’s about how you perform socially, physically, it’s about your abilities.

In my experience there were times when i felt very confident because i was good at something compared to those around me even though i didn’t like my looks. In general i would say they are linked at some point.

They go hand-in-hand with one another. If your confidence is high then so too is your esteem, and vice versa. Confidence comes from achieving meaningful things in your life (something you are designed to do), the more of the healthier your esteem becomes.

Confidence is when you know you are capable of doing something. The more confident you are the more you believe in what you deserve. The feeling of what you deserve is self esteem. Only if you are confident will you be able to say 'i don't deserve this' and only when you have a positive self esteem can you work on what you actually deserve.

If you have low self esteem it can impact your self confidence by holding you back . you may not do things that would be good for you and which would help your confidence because you don't believe in yourself.
If your regard for yourself and your abilities is high, your confidence in your ability to complete a particular task or handle a particular situation may also be high as well
